content.body:

2) the and state of National Socialism and

Compelte the main question.

How did the world end up at for a time in the century?

prompt.body: Put the names of the sections of chapter 6 in the right order.

content.body: World War Two
The Netherlands occupied
Under Hitler's spell
The Weimar Republic

prompt.body:
Combine the subquestions with the right sections in which it is answered.

Keep in mind: finally you should be able to answer these questions!

content.body: Why did Germany wind up in a major economic crisis after World War One?
How did World War Two start and progress?
How did Hitler come to power?
How did the Netherlands react to the German occupation?
Section 6.1
Section 6.2
Section 6.3
Section 6.4

prompt.body: Put the events in the right chronological order.

content.body: Wilhelm II stand down, armistice
United States particiapted in World War One, start of the Russian Revolution
Assassination of archduke Franz Ferdinand, outbreak World War One
Imperial Germany invades Belgium, France and Russia
Treaty of Versailles
Start of the American New Deal, Hitler comes to power in Germany
Stock market crash

prompt.body: Place the descriptions at the right words.

content.body: Political movement that seeks to enable every people to establish theur own government and national territory.
War in which citizens are involved and are also seen as legitimate targets.
Patriotism, especially when taken to the point believing that your own country is better than any other.
A word that refers to the period between the two World Wars.
The period of high unemployment and economic depression that affected many parts of the world after the US stock market crash on 24 october 1929.
A person who is absolutely opposed to any kind of warfare.
A war fought on a very large scale, involving countries from different continents.
The peace treaty which ende the war between Germany and the Allied Powers in 1919.
What happens oni the financial markets when share prices drop dramatically.
The use of methods similar to advertising to promote a particular view of a political issue.
The economy of a country at war, focused almosr entirely on supporting the military.
A view of a particular social issue on which most people agree.
National movement
Nationalism
Global economic crisis
Interwar Period (or: interbellum)
Propaganda
Pacifist
Total war
Stock market crash
War economy
Public opinion
Treaty of Versailles
World war

prompt.body: Put the labels at the right (historical) source.

content.body: On the way to the front in August 1914, optimistic German soldiers wrote: 'Trip to Pars' and 'See you on the boulevard' on their wagon.
Comedian Charly Chaplin parodied Adolf Hitler in the American film: 'The Great Dictator', which appeared in cinemas in 1940.
Over 1,500 US banks went bankrupt as a result of the stock market crash. Many people lost their entire savings. This photo shows a 'bankrun' in New York at the start of the Great Depression.
US President WIlson (in the center holding his hat) received a hero's welcome when he visited the UK in January 1918. The war oudl last until November.

Which words are meant with the following descriptions?

Period when Germany had a democratic rule from 1919-1933:

The ideology of Hitler:

A system in which a state controls all aspects of people's live (one word):

Hatred of the Jews:

Murder of an entire people or ethnic group:

The genocide of the Jews:

prompt.body: Put the events in the correct chronological order with help of the timeline.

content.body: Russians enter Berlin, Hitler commits suicide, Germany surrenders
Pearl Harbor, Japanese surpris attack on American navy base
Most Dutch Jews killed on concentration camps
Foundation of theWeimar Republic
Hitler invades Poland, FRance and England declare war on Germany
Germany is crippled by the stock market crash in NEw York, unemployment rises
Atomic bombs dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki, Japan surrenders, liberation of the Dutch East Indies
Fire at the Reichstag, Germany declares a state of emergency

items.content: Check page 108-122. Create a general overview, pay only attention to the sources.

prompt.body: Combine the descriptions with the right sources.

content.body: Members of the Hitlerjugend meet their idol in his last days.
Omaha Beach landing on Normandy coast on D-Day
A political cartoon about the hyperinflation in Germany in 1923. A mother, op to her chest in banknotes, lift her dying child.
A Tuesday in Westerbork: the trains are leaving for the extermination camps.
Nzai Party Day in Nuremberg, 1934.
The remains of Hiroshima after the atomic bomb.
The Stab in the Back, cartoon from 1924, published in a German magazine.
